definitions.definition: mix (a substance) with another substance so that they combine together as a mass.
examples: blend the cornstarch with a tablespoon of water
synonyms: fold in; technicaladmix; literarycommingle "blend the ingredients until smooth"

definitions.definition: mix (different types of the same substance, such as tea, coffee, liquor, etc.) together so as to make a product of the desired quality.

examples: blend basic information for the novice with some scientific gardening for the more experienced

definitions.definition: merge (a color) with another so that one is not clearly distinguishable from the other.

examples: costumes, music, and lighting all blend together beautifully
synonyms: complement "the new buildings blend with the older ones"

definitions.definition: be unobtrusive or harmonious by being similar in appearance or behavior.
examples: she would have to employ a permanent bodyguard in the house, someone who would blend in

definitions.definition: a mixture of different things or qualities.
a mixture of different types or grades of a substance, such as tea, coffee, whiskey, etc.
a word made up of the parts of others and combining their meanings, for example motel from motor and hotel.
